venue.name: In front of St. Marie's Church

item.description:
Walking Tour of the Franco-American West Side

1:30 p.m.-3:30 p.m.

$5 MHA members, $10 general public

 

Local historian and author Robert B. Perreault will lead his popular tour of the West Side that focuses on the history and contributions of the French-speaking immigrants from Quebec and their descendants. Learn about the development of Ste. Marie's parish, Notre Dame Hospital (now Catholic Medical Center), La Caisse Populaire Ste. Marie (St. Mary's Bank), and much more.

 

Pre-registration is required via the Manchester History Network Meetup website, by calling (603)622-7531 or by e-mail at history@manchesterhistoric.org.

The tour starts in front of the church at 378 Notre Dame Avenue. Please park on the street or in the church parking lot off of Amory Street.

Depicted:  Postcard of St. Marie's Church and parish buildings.
item.name: Walking Tour of the Franco-American West Side
